remarks: Any non-zero element has an atom under it.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Jun-2012.)
statement:
atle.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
atle.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
atle.z $e |- .0. = ( 0. ` K ) $.
atle.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
atle $p |- ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. B /\ X =/= .0. ) -> E. p e. A p .<_ X ) $.
$d .0. p $.
$d .<_ p $.
$d A p $.
$d B p $.
$d K p $.
$d X p $.
